page.title: 03Middle Ford Farm_Details
page.content: This is a mixed farm whose main concrern is livestock.crops are grown for the animals consumption and if there is any surplus this is then sold. The livestock on this farm consist of about one hundred and twenty crossed Devon and Frisian Beef cattle, over three hundred sheep,two hundred free range hens and two pigs.This livestock is taken into Taunton market for selling. The crops grown on the farm consist of winter barley, spring barley and corn.Stubble turnips are also grown after the spring barley has been harvested to feed to the sheep in the winter. The supliers of the farm include a local co-operative Mole Valley Farmers,a national feed firm Bibbys and various local machinery dealers.
